sv:property.sv:value: Can the address be changed later after e-filing?

In case you want to change your communication address after e-filing, you have to revise your return and file again. A fresh return will get generated with new acknowledgment number. You will have to submit the ITR-V again to the CPC,Bangalore.
Can the address be changed later after e-filing?
How many house property details can be entered ?
You can enter any number of house property details in here however please note that as per rules of Income-tax you can avail benefit of a maximum of Rs.1,50,000.
How many house property details can be entered ?
Can I enter a address outside of India?

Though it is advisable that you enter your address details of India only, however you can provide a address of outside India also.

Please note that in such case, any postal communication from Income-tax department will not reach you. But off-course you can receive an alert on your e-mail id provided.
Can I enter a address outside of India?
PAN stands for Permanent Account Number. All tax deduction details of an Individual is updated in his/her PAN database. Hence PAN is required to file Income-tax return.
What is correct format of PAN?
1) A PAN is of 10 characters. 2) A correct format for an Individual has' P' or 'H' character in the 4th place. 3) First five characters are alphabetic and next four numeric and then the last (tenth).
What is correct format of PAN?
Is it mandatory to enter first/middle name?
It is not mandatory to enter first name and middle name. You can enter only last name to proceed. If there is no last name. Then you can put your first name in the field of last name (Surname).
Is it mandatory to enter first/middle name?
Should I provide my permanent address or current address?
You are suggested to provide best available address which is convenient to postal communication for income tax department.
Should I provide my permanent address or current address?
Can my employer consider relief u/s 89(1) for the purposes of calculating my tax liability?
Yes, the employer can consider relief u/s 89 for the purpose of calculating tax liability of employee.
Can my employer consider relief u/s 89(1) for the purposes of calculating my tax liability?
What is the limit of 80 DDB deduction?

The amount deductible is lower of actually spent of Rs. 40000 and in case expenditure incurred for a relative who is a senior citizen then the amount deducitble is lower of Rs. 60000 or actually spent.
What is the limit of 80 DDB deduction?
What is the limit of 80 E deduction?
There is no limit as to amount of deduction, but the limit may be availability of Gross Total Income to the extent interest paid for amount borrowed for higher education is allowed as deduction.
What is the limit of 80 E deduction?
Deduction u/s 80C is in relation to specific investment or contribution or deposits or payments.
Yes. However certain benefit of spread over of income to the years to which it relates can be availed for lower incidence of tax. This is called relief u/s 89(1) of Income-tax Act.
Deductions is available to person who are not receiving House Rent Allowances for payments made towards rent.
Deduction in respect of royalty income, etc., of authors of certain books other than text books received by resident individual.
MICR - Magnetic Ink Character Recognition is a technology of processing cheques. It is of 9 digits and can be found in your bank account's cheque book.
Deduction in respect of profits and gains from business of collecting and processing of bio-degradable waste.
Is pension income considered as salary?
Yes. However pension received from the United Nation is exempt.
Is pension income considered as salary?
Is family pension considered as salary?
No. It is taxable under other sources.
Is family pension considered as salary?
Benefits of obtaining a Permanent Account Number [PAN]

A PAN number has been made compulsory for every transaction with the Income Tax department. It is also mandatory for numerous other financial transactions such as opening of bank accounts, availing institutional financial credits, purchase of high-end consumer item, foreign travel, transaction of immovable properties, dealing in securities etc. A PAN card is a valuable means of photo identification accepted by all government and non-government institutions in the country.
Benefits of obtaining a Permanent Account Number [PAN]
What is the limit of 80 IB deduction?
The amount of deductions are profit linked as specified under the Income Tax Act, 1961 at specified percentage over specified number of years.
What is the limit of 80 IB deduction?

ECS is an electronic mode of funds transfer from one bank account to another. It can be used by institutions for making payments such as distribution of dividend interest, salary, pension, among others. It can also be used to pay bills and other charges such as telephone, electricity, water or for making equated monthly installments payments on loans as well as SIP investments. ECS can be used for both credit and debit purposes.
I have been allotted two PANs. Which number should I use?
I have been allotted two PANs. Which number should I use?
You may retain any one of the numbers and surrender the other through a letter addressed to your jurisdictional Assessing Officer.
Even if no taxes have been deducted from salary, is there any need for my employer to issue Form-16 to me?
Form-16 is a certificate of TDS and in your case it will not apply. However your employer must issue a salary statement.
Even if no taxes have been deducted from salary, is there any need for my employer to issue Form-16 to me?

ITR-V stands for 'Income-tax Verification' form. If an e-filing is done without digital signature, it generates an acknowledgment called ITR-V.

 

This form needs to be signed in manually and posted to CPC, Bangalore within 120 days of e-filing of return.

A financial year is a period for which your taxes and income are computed and for which you have to file your return. Financial Year is considered from 1st of April of a year to 31st of march of next year. For example FY 2011-12 means it starts from 1st of April of 2011 to 31st of March of 2012. You have to file the return afterwards.

 

Please note that Financial Year 2011-12 means Assessment Year 2012-13.
Assessment year is the year in which the income earned is assessed.
What is considered as Salary income?
Whatever is received by an employee from an employer in cash, kind or as a facility [perquisite] is considered as Salary.
What is considered as Salary income?
If I sell my land will I be taxed?
Gain from sale of non-agriculture land is taxable as capital gain. Gain from sale of agriculture land is taxable only if it is located within 8 kilometers from the urban limits.
If I sell my land will I be taxed?
